title: Cover Crops and Soil Health Partnerships with Abbey Wick

tasks.task: Attend and facilitate soil health workshops and collaboration events.
subtasks: Recruit and coordinate partnerships with researchers, extension agents, crop consultants, and farmers.
Organize farmer-led on-farm trials and soil health demonstrations.
Conduct data collection and analysis for project reports and evaluations.
Develop and publish podcasts and video series highlighting farmer case studies.
Foster trust and open communication with farmers through support during agricultural crises.
Promote best practices for no-till farming, cover cropping, and residue management.

tasks.task: Evaluate cover crop efficacy in agroecosystems.
subtasks: Test various cover crop mixtures and seeding methods in different cropping systems.
Monitor nutrient cycling and soil organic matter accumulation in cover crop treatments.
Assess yield impacts and weed suppression in cover crop-adjacent cash crop plantings.
Compare soil health metrics between conventional and minimum-till management practices.

tasks.task: Build a farmer collaboration network for soil health advancement.
subtasks: Organize regional meetings, talks, and roundtable discussions to share knowledge.
Network extension agents and researchers to directly inform farmer practices.
Train crop consultants in soil health principles and integrated pest management.
Encourage farmer-to-farmer learning through success stories and peer review.

tasks.task: Transition agricultural operations to sustainable soil management.
subtasks: Advise farmers on implementing cover crop rotations and no-till practices.
Evaluate equipment modifications for residue incorporation and conservation tillage.
Minimize water erosion and soil compaction through optimized field practices.
Reduce dependency on synthetic inputs through increased organic matter and biological activity.
